intro: Oberonia variabilis, commonly known as the variable orchid, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hanging stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture. The flowers, which can be white, yellow, or green, are often fragrant and attract various pollinators.
